page.title: 02WEDNESDAY MARKET LEEK
page.content: In Leek there is an indoor and outdoor market in the market place on Wednesdays.The market place carpark is cleared on Tuesday night and the stalls set up by council workmen.There are about 103 stalls selling clothes,vegetables and fruit,household goods and toys. The rent of 7 pounds is collected each Wednesday. The market place is cobbled with a central lamp-post to replace the original Butter-cross which is now in the cemetary.The indoor Butter Market was built in 1897,but Leek has had a market since 1208.The hall has lock up stalls. No uncooked meat must be sold in the outside market.Anyone can set up a stall although adults are preferred!
